caption.p:
The effect of the rate of isolation on the outbreak. An exponential-like decline in the size of the epidemic if the rate of isolation of suspected cases is within a range of 50% around the estimated value of 0.94 for ( a) patients and ( b) both types of HCWs. Local ( c) and global ( d) sensitivity of the values of
R 0
over time to the rate of isolation (
Î± 6
). In ( d) partial rank correlation coefficient (PRCC) of the rate of isolation and
R 0
over time shows a negative significant correlation ( p-value = 0). That association weakened over time but stayed significant.
